content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

Set Up Actions to Insert Articles into Channels in Lightning Knowledge

With the Lightning Knowledge component and related list actions, agents can directly embed article content into the body of customer emails and in social, chat, and messaging conversations.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience and all editions with Knowledge except Essentials.
Salesforce Knowledge is available for an additional cost in: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, and Developer Editions.

USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To administer Salesforce Knowledge: Customize Application and Manage Salesforce Knowledge.
To send article content in emails: Edit on cases and Read on knowledge articles.
To send article content in social, chat, and messaging channels: Edit on cases and Edit on the social, chat, or messaging object and Read on knowledge articles.

To share internal articles externally: Share internal Knowledge articles externally under Administrative Permissions.

To share articles in emails, Email-to-case must be enabled. To share articles in social posts, Social Customer Service is enabled. To share articles in chat or messaging conversations, configure Chat or Messaging.

From the Object Manager, choose the Knowledge object.
Under Communication Channel Mappings, click New.
Enter a label and name.
Add the desired channels to the Selected Channels list.

Only plain text is supported in social, chat, and messaging. Choose whether to include field labels and related files with inserted articles.

Click Save.
The appropriate action appears in the Knowledge component and article related lists in cases when you save a communication channel mapping for the channel.

(Optional) To let users share the contents of internal articles, enable Share internal Knowledge articles externally under App Permissions for the profile or permission set.
title: Setting Up Knowledge Component Actions in Service Cloud
